text: [Music]
three little pigs
[Music]
once upon a time mommy pig and her three
little pigs lived in a blue house but it
was too small so the pigs went out to
find new homes the first little pig
built a house from straw he was very
happy with his straw house the second
little pig built a house from sticks he
was very happy with his wooden house the
third little pig wanted to build a house
that was stronger than the other two he
built his house from bricks
a big bad wolf was roaming in woods he
went to the first Little Pigs house he
looked inside the window and saw the
first little thing
the big bad wolf huffed and puffed he
blew the house made from straw away the
first little pig ran to the second
little pig's house
the big bad wolf went to the second
little pigs
stick house he looked inside and saw the
two little pigs
the big bad wolf huffed and puffed he
blew the house made from sticks away the
two little pigs ran to the third little
pig's house
the big bad wolf went to the third
little pig's house he looked inside the
window you saw the three little pigs in
the house together
the big bad wolf huffed and puffed but
he could not blow away the house made
from bricks the brick house was too
strong for the wolf the big bad wolf
came up with a plan he climbed up the
roots to jump down the chimney
the wolf landed in a pot of boiling
water the Three Little Pigs had put the
pot on the fire underneath the chimney
the big bad wolf ran out of the house
the three little pigs were very happy
they lived happily ever after
Midas and the golden touch once there
lived a kind and wealthy king named
Midas he was so obsessed with wealth
that he would dream of it every night
one day might as one elderly man in the
garden he invited the man to his palace
at the palace a young man wearing a
leafy crown appeared he was looking for
the elderly man the elderly man said - -
this is Dionysus he is a god Dionysus
said to Midas you've been very kind to
my friend in return I will grant you a
wish
Midas wished everything I touch
must turn to gold so be it said Dionysus
snapping his fingers instantly Midas's
wooden stick turned into a gold one
Midas touched his palace and the walls
turned to dazzling gold he felt like the
richest man in the world it was dinner
time and midas was hungry but when he
touched his food it turned to gold oh no
his daughter heard his cries she ran
towards Midas and hugged him even she
turned into a golden statue he cried for
help from dialysis dialysis appeared he
said bathing in the river will wash away
your gift midas stepped into the river
and his stick became wooden again he
went back to his palace everything was
back to normal
midas was very happy he promised to
never be greedy again the ugly duckling
[Music]
one day mother duck was sitting in her
nest with her little ducklings they were
waiting for one big egg to hatch soon
the big egg hatched the duckling was
different it was bigger and ugly mother
duck hoped that the duckling would
change mother duck and the ducklings
went swimming in the pond the ugly
duckling could swim much better than the
other ducklings mother duck took the
ducklings to the farm the farm animals
saw the ugly duckling they were mean to
him he became very sad this continued
for many days one night the ugly
duckling went far far away
fell asleep in a muddy Marsh the next
morning the Ugly Duckling met some wild
ducks they told him that he was ugly and
asked him to leave the ugly duckling was
very sad months passed by but nobody was
ready to be his friend
one day the ugly duckling saw three
beautiful white swans swimming in a pond
the three Swan said hello new Swan the
ugly duckling told them that he was a
duck the Swans told him to look at his
reflection in the water the ugly
duckling was amazed he had grown into a
handsome white swan he was no longer
ugly the four Swans flew up in the sky
the children on the ground clapped as
the Swans flew above them
[Music]
the giant turnip once upon a time there
lived an old man with his wife the old
man planted some turnip seeds he watered
them and cared for them the seeds grew
into plants there were lots of turnips
the old man took good care of them out
of all those turnips
there was one huge turnip he had never
seen a giant turnip before finally the
turnip stopped running the old man
decided to pull it out of the ground he
pulled and pulled and pulled but the
giant turnip wouldn't budge the old man
called his wife for help the wife held
the old man and the old man held the
turnip top together they pulled and
pulled that pole they caught their son
for help together they pulled and pulled
and pulled with the giant turnip
wouldn't budge they called their doc for
help together they pulled and pulled but
the giant turnips still wouldn't budge
[Music]
at last they are called the little mouse
for help he crawled his way under the
turnip and started looting the roots
with his teeth while the little mouse
nips the roots they kept pulling and
suddenly out of the ground came the
giant turnip
everyone was pleased that evening they
all enjoyed a delicious turnips supper
even the little mouse the Frog Prince
[Music]
one day a beautiful princess was playing
catch with her golden ball near a pond
by mistake
she dropped the ball it rolled down the
bait and sank into the depths of the
pond
my Golden Bough is lost forever said the
princess I didn't find it for you
croaked a frog the princess hated frogs
she couldn't bear to look at him but she
said anyway I'll give you pearls and
diamonds if you do I don't want pearls
and diamonds I want to eat from your
plate drink from your ah sleep in your
bed will you promise me I promise she
said the Frog dived deep into the pond
he returned with the golden ball the
princess became very happy she snatched
it from the froggen ran away that
evening the princess and her family were
having dinner there was a gentle knock
at the door
a croaky voice called out remember your
promise dear princess who is that the
king asked the princess eat frogs who
found my lost bone
promised to share my plate with him do
as you promised
thundered the king unwillingly the
princess picked up the frog the frog ate
from her plate and drank from her cup
she took him to her room the Frog hopped
onto her bed and slept the princess was
disgusted the Frog ate from her plate
and slept in her bed for three days on
the fourth evening she heard a knock on
the door standing at the door was a
handsome prince who are you
stammered the princess I am a prince a
wicked witch turned me into a frog
princess you have been very kind to me
you have freed me from the spell will
you marry me
the princess was enchanted with the
handsome prince she agreed immediately
they married and lived together happily
ever after
so once upon a time a young couple lived
near an enchanted garden but no one ever
set foot in the garden because it was
owned by a witch one day the wife who
was expecting a baby began to crave
spring leaves from the witch's garden
[Music]
her husband bravely picked the leaves of
a plant named Rapunzel the witch caught
him the husband said it's for my
pregnant wife in return
the witch demanded to take the child
the couple was soon blessed with a
little girl the witch arrived at their
door and took the baby away she decided
to name her Rapunzel
years passed and Rapunzel turned 13 the
witch locked her in a tower with no door
the witch would climb the tower using
Rapunzel's long hair one day a prince
saw Rapunzel sitting at the window he
was instantly enchanted by her rapunzel
let down her hair and the Prince climbed
up you must go before the witch finds
you said Rapunzel the prince promised to
help her escape with a rope ladder when
the witch returned she sensed that a man
had been named in anger she chopped off
Rapunzel's long golden hair and locked
her in a cover
the prints arrived again and climbed up
but the witch was holding the long hair
she tried to push him away the Prince
managed to dodge the witch she lost her
balance and fell on the ground with a
thud the Prince found Rapunzel in the
cupboard they climbed down the rope
ladder and fled soon they got married
and lived happily ever after Little Red
Riding Hood
[Music]
once upon a time there lived a girl near
a forest she always wore a red hood
everyone called her Little Red Riding
Hood one day mom asked Little Red Riding
Hood to visit grandma who lived on the
other side of the forest Little Red
Riding Hood went into the forest
carrying a basket of fruits for Grandma
a big bad wolf was watching her the
Wolves asked Little Red Riding Hood
where are you going I'm going to see
grandma she replied the wolf suggested
that she should pick some flowers for
Grandma as Little Red Riding Hood was
picking the flowers the wolf ran off he
wanted to get to Grandma's house before
her
the wolf arrived at Grandma's house she
was sleeping in her bed the hungry wolf
swallowed her up the wolf dressed
himself in grandma's clothes and climbed
into her bed Little Red Riding Hood
knocked on the door the wolf asked her
to come in Little Red Riding Hood
entered and saw grandma she noticed that
grandma looked very strange the wolf
jumped out of the bed Little Red Riding
Hood screamed whoa Little Red Riding
Hood ran from the house the wolf chased
after her a woodcutter saw them
the brave woodcutter picked the wolf up
he shook the wolf and grandma came out
she was safe the wolf ran away they
thanks the woodcutter for helping them
Little Red Riding Hood promised grandma
to never talk to strangers again he
locks and the three bears
[Music]
once upon a time there lived a family of
three bears in the forest one morning
their porridge was too hot to eat so
they went for a walk instead while they
were out a naughty little girl named
Goldilocks came wandering through the
woods she entered their house she saw a
table with three bowls of porridge there
was one large bowl one middle sized bowl
and one small boy Goldilocks sat on the
biggest chair and tried the porridge
from the biggest bowl but the cushion on
the chair was very hard in the porridge
too hot
[Music]
then she settled in the smaller chair
she tried some porridge from the smaller
Bowl but the chair was too soft and the
porridge too cold finally she jumped
into the tiny chair and tasted some
porridge from the small bowl it was
delicious
but her weight broke the chair into
pieces Goldilocks went upstairs there
was one bedroom with three beds she
climbed into the big bed but it was too
hard the middle bed was far too soft
then Goldilocks climbed into the
smallest bed it was perfect
soon Goldilocks fell asleep
[Music]
the three bears came back home when they
looked at their Bulls they were shocked
someone had eaten baby bears porridge
[Music]
they even realized that somebody had
been sitting on their chairs baby bear
saw his broken chair and sobbed they
went upstairs to their bedroom baby bear
saw Goldilocks and screamed somebody's
been sleeping in my bed he screamed so
loudly that Goldilocks woke up she ran
into the forest the three bears never
saw her again
[Music]
once upon a time there lived a beautiful
girl named Cinderella she lived with her
mean stepmother and her two cruel and
stepsisters
[Music]
one day the stepsisters received an
invitation for a ball at the Royal
Palace
what a shame maids aren't invited to
cheered the stepsisters
[Music]
as soon as her stepsisters left
Cinderella
cried her heart out
[Music]
she wanted to go to the ball suddenly
she heard a voice from the back I'm your
fairy godmother I will fulfill your wish
[Music]
the fairy godmother magically
transformed Cinderella and her friends
she told Cinderella to return before
midnight
[Music]
as soon as the handsome prince saw
Cinderella he was instantly enchanted
they both danced together
[Music]
the clock struck twelve and Cinderella
immediately ran out of the palace she
panicked and lost a glass slipper in the
palace
the puzzled prince chased after her but
only found the slipper
the lovestruck prince went from house to
house making every girl try on the
slipper
soon he reached the stepsisters house
they snatched a slipper from him and
tried it on their feet in vain
[Music]
then the Prince asked Cinderella to try
on the slipper her dainty foot was a
perfect fit the Prince gasped in delight
the Prince took Cinderella back to his
palace they got married and lived
happily ever after
Beauty and the Beast once there lived a
merchant with three daughters the two
elder daughters were selfish and wicked
the youngest one was so sweet that he
named her beauty
once the merchant had to go away for
work what gifts do you want yes the
eldest demanded a pearl necklace
the second wanted diamonds Beauty asked
for a red rose while returning the
merchant had gifts for his two elder
daughters but he couldn't find the
perfect rose for beauty suddenly he
stumbled upon an enchanting castle and
went inside there was no one in the
castle strangely a royal feast was laid
out at the dining table he was very
hungry
so he ate the food he went upstairs and
went to bed
[Music]
next morning the merchant saw some
beautiful red roses in the garden of the
castle Wow
I must take one of these roses for
beauty he said a scary beast appeared
and demanded to know why he was stealing
his rose the merchant replied that it
was for his daughter Beauty then you
must send Beauty to live with me the
Beast replied
on reaching home the merchants voice
trembled as II told Beauty everything I
must go Father
Beauty son
bravely Beauty went to the castle the
Beast always treated her with kindness
and respect
soon she became fond of him after some
days Beauty started missing her father
badly beast let her go home
beauty promised to return soon
her father was delighted to see her her
sisters claimed to be happy but they
were furious to see her return Beauty
loved her family's company
one night she dreamed of the beast lying
on the floor in poor health she went to
the castle immediately she found the
beast in the exact same condition why
didn't you come back soon gasped the
Beast she sobbed
he asked her to marry him she agreed
immediately instantly the Beast turned
into a handsome prince
Oh beauty thank you
a wicked magician turned me into a beast
the spell would only end if a beautiful
girl would have promised to marry me
he said soon they were married the
merchant was very happy with the
marriage they lived happily ever after
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
